p: The common type species of Nocardia include Nocardia asteroides, Nocardia brasiliensis, Nocardia farcinica, Nocardia otitidiscaviarum, etc., all of which may cause a variety of diseases in both humans and animals. Nocardia is an opportunistic pathogen and mainly affects immunosuppression patients ( 3, 5), such as patients with acquired immune deficiency syndrome (AIDS) ( 9), chronic granulomatous disease ( 10, 11), transplant recipients ( 12, 13), and with drug-induced systemic immunosuppression ( 14). It is also found that one-third of nocardiosis patients are immunocompetent ( 15).
